intro: Calceolaria lanceolata f. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved calceolaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. Its botanical structure includes hairy stems and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
